title: Sources: Pacers' Haliburton has torn Achilles
content: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton sustained a torn right Achilles tendon in Game 7 of the NBA Finals against Oklahoma City, sources told ESPN.

title: Durant deal, Haliburton injury shake up title odds
content: The Rockets' trade for Kevin Durant and the injury suffered by the Pacers' Tyrese Haliburton shook up the early odds to win next season's NBA title, but the clear-cut favorite remains the champion Thunder.

title: Poch awed by U.S. leader Tillman: 'What a player'
content: United States manager Mauricio Pochettino said he was pleased to see his team deliver a "professional performance" in defeating Haiti 2-1 in the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Bradley win 'opens the door' as playing captain
content: After winning the Travelers Championship, will Keegan Bradley be a playing captain for the U.S. at the Ryder Cup in September? That's a decision only he can make.

title: Sources: UGA WR pledge Spafford flips to Miami
content: The Miami Hurricanes have landed 4-star WR recruit Vance Spafford, who flipped his commitment from Georgia, sources told ESPN. Spafford was the longest-tenured member of the Bulldogs' 2026 recruiting class.

title: Ducks deal Zegras to Flyers for Poehling, 2 picks
content: The Ducks have traded Trevor Zegras to the Flyers for Ryan Poehling and two draft picks -- the No. 45 pick of the 2025 NHL draft and a fourth-round pick in 2026.

title: N.Y. Jets owner buys stake in Crystal Palace team
content: New York Jets owner Woody Johnson has agreed on a £190 million deal ($254m) to buy a 43% stake in Premier League team Crystal Palace from American businessman John Textor, the club announced on Monday.

title: Lukas in hospital, won't return to training horses
content: Hall of Famer D. Wayne Lukas, 89, has been hospitalized and won't return to training horses. His horses have been transferred to assistant Sebastian "Bas" Nicholl.

title: Brady wins inaugural Fanatics Games, $1M prize
content: Tom Brady emerged Sunday as the winner of the inaugural Fanatics Games, which pitted athletes and celebrities against fans in eight competitions this weekend at Fanatics Fest in New York.

title: ⚾ Redrafting MLB draft top-10 picks, 2015-24
content: Witt over Rutschman? Does Skenes still go No. 1? Let's go back in time to right the wrongs of the past 10 MLB drafts.

title: How close is your team to an NBA title? We tiered all 30 franchises
content: While the world watched the Finals, the league's hierarchy shifted. Is OKC already looking over its shoulder ?

title: Why this Thunder big 3 might be the one to start a dynasty
content: When the Thunder set out to build a champion, they learned hard lessons from how their historic trio of KD, Russell Westbrook and James Harden flamed out a decade ago.

title: New NBA mock draft, two days before Round 1: Latest buzz on the chaotic top-10 picks
content: Will the 76ers, Hornets and Jazz take best-player-available approaches? We project both rounds of the NBA draft.

title: Grading the deal: Houston goes all-in, but did Phoenix get enough?
content: The Suns and Rockets have agreed to a deal that lands Kevin Durant in Houston. Which side won the trade?

title: 5 things we've learned about the 'freaking awesome' NL West
content: The most dynamic division in baseball has been tons of fun so far. After 17 games in 18 days, here are five lessons.

title: Why 'treatment of families' matters to NFL players -- and where some teams fall short
content: From the Vikings (A+) to the Bengals (F-), we asked players what the expectations are in team treatment of their families.

title: Buzz: How Blackhawks, Isles, Predators could shake up first round
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: USMNT completes 'perfect' group stage that was anything but
content: Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT made it three-for-three in the Gold Cup group stage, but there is clearly plenty still to work on for the Americans.

title: Echeverri shows he can shine for Man City, Alonso gets first Madrid win
content: Claudio Echeverri's 45-minute cameo has given Pep Guardiola plenty to think about, while Xabi Alonso got his first win as Real Madrid coach. Here's what you need to know from Sunday's Club World Cup action.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: Whitcomb, Amihere lead top pickups this week
content: Sami Whitcomb and Laeticia Amihere are positioned to produce for their teams and fantasy managers ahead of a busy week in the WNBA.

title: Source: Barça close in on Roony Bardghji transfer
content: Barcelona are close to completing the signing of Copenhagen FC winger Roony Bardghji, a source has told ESPN.

title: Guardiola hails Echeverri after first City goal
content: Pep Guardiola has hailed Claudio Echeverri as an "incredible player" after the Argentinian youngster scored his first goal for Manchester City.

title: Costa Rica draws with Mexico, meets U.S. in last 8
content: Mexico drew 0-0 with Costa Rica on Sunday night at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas to win Group A of the CONCACAF Gold Cup and will play Saudi Arabia in the quarterfinals.

title: Palmeiras CB to 'Sui' if he scores vs. Messi's Miami
content: Palmeiras defender Murilo says he will copy Cristiano Ronaldo's trademark 'SIU' celebration if he scores against Lionel Messi's Inter Miami at the Club World Cup.

title: Alonso: FIFA investigating racist abuse of Rüdiger
content: Real Madrid coach Xabi Alonso said he believed Antonio Rüdiger when the player told him he was a victim of racist abuse during their 3-1 win against Mexican side Pachuca at the Club World Cup on Sunday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United linked with Kean swoop
content: Manchester United want to sign a striker and are looking at Fiorentina's Moise Kean. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Lack of funds has put Karnataka MLAs in a spot, Congress leaders feel
content: While Kagwad MLA Raju Kage threatens to quit his membership of the Assembly over the slow pace of works, Sagar MLA Belur Gopalakrishna seeks resignation of Housing Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan

title: Global politics dictated by realism and self-interest and not solidarity: V-P Jaideep Dhankhar
content: Speaking at the launch of a book written by senior RSS leader Ram Madhav, the Vice-President calls for a shift in India’s foreign policy imagination, says this is the right time to move beyond ‘romanticism’ and focus on economic and strategic strength

title: Trade unions question Railway Board’s decision to re-engage retired staff
content: Criticism comes after the Railway Board issued an order on June 20 empowering Divisional Railway Managers to appoint retired staff as volunteers in non-gazetted posts

title: Centre using technology to exclude vulnerable sections: Congress on face authentication for anganwadi beneficiaries
content: The Women and Child Development Ministry had directed all States and Union Territories (UTs) to implement a mandatory face recognition system for take-home ration distribution and child attendance monitoring at anganwadi centres

title: AAP wins Ludhiana bypoll in Punjab; political circles see it as a face-saving victory
content: Congress candidate and working president of the State unit in Punjab resigns in the aftermath of the results

title: A.P. seeing welfare, development under NDA rule, says Purandeswari
content: After five years of bad governance, the people in the State elected good government: BJP State president

title: Tharoor’s praise of PM Modi exposes Rahul: BJP
content: Tharoor wrote in The Hindu that Modi’s ‘energy, dynamism and willingness to engage was a prime asset for India on the global stage’ and it deserved more backing

title: Trinamool Congress wins Kaliganj Assembly by-election, BJP sees silver lining
content: After the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, byelections to 11 Assembly constituencies have been held in the State and the Trinamool Congress won all the 11 seats

title: Naidu unveils Swarna Andhra Vision, a blueprint for reconstruction, inclusive growth
content: NDA alliance’s historic electoral win is a mandate for reconstruction, says CM setting forth a roadmap for State on the first anniversary of the NDA government

title: West Bengal CM meets new Bangladesh High Commissioner at State Secretariat
content: According to officials present at the meeting, the deliberations were held in a “warm and cordial atmosphere” and the Chief Minister reflected her ideas on development of people with the Bangladeshi envoy

title: Indian private sector in ‘developing’ stage: Jitendra Singh
content: Several projects have been rolled out but we don’t have the private sector acumen, the Science, Space and Atomic Energy Minister says, adding that it will require some time and capacity building has started

title: Ruling National Conference sets up human rights wing in J&K
content: The cell will document cases of rights violations and ensure the human rights of locals are protected, says National Congress chief Farooq Abdullah. He reiterates demand for restoration of Statehood to J&K, while dismissing rumours about conditional restoration of Statehood

title: More than 20 targets were identified under Operation Sindoor
content: Modi and Rajnath held detailed discussions with intelligence and defence forces after the list of targets was drawn up; India attacked nine of them later

title: Operation Sindoor met all objectives, instilled fear in terrorists, says Rajnath
content: Defence Minister releases book on President Murmu’s speeches; praises her as the ‘best example of women-led development’ in India

title: UDF unity pays off, anti-incumbency hurts LDF
content: In the intensely contested byelection, where both the UDF and the LDF invested heavily in resources and campaigning, anti-incumbency sentiment proves pivotal to UDF candidate Aryadan Shoukath’s victory

title: Assembly bypolls: AAP retains both seats; BJP, Congress, Trinamool bag one each
content: The Congress wrests Nilambur in Kerala from the LDF-backed candidate, while in West Bengal, the ruling Trinamool Congress has won the Kaliganj seat amid a myriad of controversies and protests

title: My life is in danger, says Lalu’s elder son Tej Pratap
content: He rejected the speculation of forming a separate political party ahead of the Assembly election. RJD chief Lalu Prasad on May 25 expelled his son from the party and snapped all family ties with him, stating that his actions were ‘irresponsible’ and not in accordance with public conduct

title: Our jawans will win the war against Maoism, says Shah
content: Home Minister says Maoist violence deprived the poor tribal population of basic necessities such as food, electricity, education, housing, toilets, and clean drinking water — let alone any possibility of industrial development

title: Doval begins China visit for SCO meet, Rajnath to arrive this week
content: First batch of Kailash Mansarovar yatris reach Tibet; New Delhi-Beijing exchanges expected to lead to resumption of direct flights and Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s scheduled visit to China for the SCO Summit in August, say officials.

title: Tamil actor Srikanth arrested for allegedly buying cocaine from a drug cartel
content: A senior police officer confirmed the arrest and said Srikanth had been in regular contact with three drug offenders who were arrested recently

title: Telangana’s VeriFast app sets national benchmark in passport verification
content: Director General of Intelligence B. Shivadhar Reddy to receive the Certificate of Excellence in New Delhi from the Minister of External Affairs

title: BJP president J.P. Nadda pays tribute to Syama Prasad Mookerjee
content: The BJP chief said the Bharatiya Jana Sangh founding president had ‘made the supreme sacrifice while opposing Articles 370 and 35A, which granted special status to Jammu and Kashmir’

title: Rythu Bharosa disbursement to be completed today
content: Agri. Minister Tummala Nageswara Rao sayd ₹8,285 cr credited to bank accounts of 67.01 lakh landholders in just 7 days

title: Air India Express flight to Jammu returns to Delhi due to suspected ‘GPS interference’
content: A spokesman of the airline said the flight returned to Delhi as a precautionary measure following a suspected “GPS interference” and an alternative aircraft was later provided to the passengers to reach their destination

title: Students complain of errors in Plus Two mark lists
content: Errors found in continuous evaluation marks. Officials blame printing firm, say corrected mark lists will reach schools beginning Tuesday

title: Traffic snarls the norm at Venjaramoodu with flyover work remaining a non-starter
content: MLA says work was delayed due to issues related to the preparation of estimates for shifting utility wires

title: 10-year-old tribal girl branded with hot iron for allegedly stealing phone in Nellore district
content: Victim admitted to hospital with severe burns, police register case against five persons, including her aunt

title: Supreme Court to consider question of issuance of OBC certificates for children of single mothers
content: The apex court had sought responses from the Centre and the Delhi government in January on the case filed by a Delhi woman

title: SCERT’s academic master plan for schools envisages planning at multiple levels
content: Besides school master plan, class, subject-level, and individual master plans too need to be prepared

title: Tender for locomotive manufacturing at Dahod executed transparently: Indian Railways
content: Rebutting allegations by the Congress, the Railways spokesperson said that about 89% of the components used in the the current locomotive manufacturing process at Dahod were made in India

title: Genome-edited rice seed Pusa DST Rice 1 expected to reach farmers within a year: IARI Joint Director Viswanathan Chinnusamy
content: He says genome editing helps to overcome limitations in seeds and add specific desirable traits in them

title: Among slain Maoists in Chhattisgarh since 2024, one-third were women, show data
content: According to Home Ministry, faced with coercion and threats, many poor Adivasi parents prefer to part with the girlchild and this inhuman practice by Maoists is the reason behind large number of young girls/women being present among Maoist cadres

title: Upper Kuttanad farmers to boycott upcoming paddy season over payment delays
content: Move after repeated discussions with Supplyco failed to yield any progress regarding the disbursement of pending payments

title: U.S. travel advisory leaves Kerala’s tourism sector uneasy
content: Though the State is not mentioned in the advisory, those in the sector feel that the references to increasing instances of rape and terrorist activities in other parts of the country will negatively impact State’s tourism prospects. An average foreign tourist will just drop the country from their itinerary

title: One-way traffic plan for RK Puram as twin bridge takes shape
content: Traffic studies have led to the decision to build a new three-lane unidirectional Railway Overbridge alongside the existing one, along with a parallel Road Under Bridge, to reduce congestion and improve traffic flow

title: Manufacturing units planned in northeast States for vegan leather developed by CSIR-NIIST
content: The technology provides a sustainable solution to produce plant-based leather from agro-waste, a growing challenge in northeast India, says NIIST

title: Shut funding channels to terrorists, Union Minister Puri on Kanishka bombing anniversary
content: Union Minister Hardeep Puri pays tribute to Air India Flight 182 victims, calls for global unity against terrorism

title: CM says Joshi did not help State get grants recommended by Finance Commission
content: According to Siddaramaiah, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi is considered to be an influential Minister having good rapport with the Prime Minister

title: Tamil Nadu government transfers over 50 IAS officers; P. Sankar is the Higher Education Secretary
content: C. Samayamoorthy has been posted as the Secretary of the Human Resources Management Department. The government has also named new Collectors for nine districts and new Commissioners for six Municipal Corporations

title: Konaseema Migration Centre in talks with agencies abroad to secure safe jobs for locals
content: Established in March, the Centre had successfully repatriated seven workers after they decided to return to Konaseema; It traced 33 victims who were cheated by local agents so far

title: Rajeeve launches Layam Housing project in Idukki
content: 83 layams  have been selected for renovation under the project in Idukki and works on 10 units at AVT Karadikkuzhi Estate, near Peerumade, have been completed

title: Congress govt. has fulfilled 242 promises out of 593 in two years, claims Siddaramaiah
content: The Chief Minister says that the State government is delivering good governance to the people by fulfilling promises

title: 'No threat to brotherly Qatar': Iran says used same bomb count as US
content: In a retaliatory move, Iran targeted a US base in Qatar on Sunday evening, following America's alliance with Israel in the conflict against Tehran. Iran's security body declared that the attack mirrored the scale of US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. Reuters reported the base's location away from Qatari urban and residential zones.

title: New US Visa rule: F, M, & J visa applicants to change privacy setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: Shashi Tharoor calls PM Modi 'prime asset'; hails his 'energy, dynamism'
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor praised Prime Minister Modi's energy and global engagement as a key asset for India, even as his own party criticizes the government's foreign policy. Tharoor highlighted the success of diplomatic outreach following 'Operation Sindoor,' emphasizing national unity and clear communication.

title: Elon Musk’s simple life: World’s richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: Pant-astic: Rishabh makes history - 1st Indian keeper with 100s in both innings
content: Rishabh Pant etched his name in history by becoming the first Indian wicketkeeper to score centuries in both innings of a Test match. Pant's remarkable feat occurred on Day 4 against England at Headingley, marking his eighth Test century.

title: Will ‘world chicken out’? What happens to Trump’s tariffs after US attack on Iran
content: Following US strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities and ongoing tensions, global markets are reassessing Donald Trump's willingness to act decisively. The previous assumption that Trump would back down from threats, particularly regarding tariffs, is now in question. The economic impact hinges on Iran's response, with potential scenarios ranging from global cooperation to a full-blown trade war and recession.

title: Surprise: How Bill Gates, Melinda Gates reacted; when daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: Inside Trump’s war room: How 'Op Midnight Hammer' against Iran was planned
content: President Trump authorized a high-precision military strike on Iranian nuclear facilities, marking a significant escalation in US-Iran tensions. The operation, executed by B-2 stealth bombers, followed stalled diplomatic talks and a firm ultimatum from Trump regarding Iran's nuclear program. The decision, made amidst internal deliberations and political considerations, represents a sharp departure from previous US policy, with uncertain regional consequences.

title: Dwyane Wade’s daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit “What Jhumka?” while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: 'Kept Sanjay out of discussions': Indira Gandhi’s principal secretary in new book
content: In a significant blow to Kerala's ruling LDF, the UDF secured victory in the Nilambur assembly bypoll, marking the first loss of a sitting seat for the LDF during its current term. Congress candidate Aryadan Shoukath defeated CPI(M)'s M Swaraj by a margin of 11,077 votes.

title: 'She's heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: IND vs ENG: Gavaskar calls for Pant's signature somersault celebration, wicketkeeper politely declines - WATCH
content: Rishabh Pant etched his name in history at Headingley, becoming the first wicketkeeper-batter to score centuries in both innings of a Test. His second innings ton was followed by Sunil Gavaskar playfully urging him to repeat his first-innings somersault celebration. Pant's adaptability was also on display, shifting from aggressive shots to a defensive approach, earning praise from Deep Dasgupta.

title: ITR FY25: What's the exemption limit - who still needs to file?
content: Filing income tax returns for FY 2024-25 is necessary if taxable income exceeds ₹3 lakh (new regime) or ₹2.5 lakh (old regime). Mandatory filing also applies to high-value transactions like large deposits, foreign travel expenses, or high electricity bills.

title: Adin Ross returns with Brand Risk 008: Date, full fight card revealed
content: Adin Ross is set to host Brand Risk 008 in Nashville on June 22, 2025, featuring a main event between Charleston White and Kodiyakredd. The event, streamed live on Kick, includes nine influencer matchups with personalities like Scam Likely, Julian Newman, and Supreme Patty. Following a chaotic Brand Risk 007, expect more drama and unexpected moments.

title: Jersey number 0: Is it cursed? Fans can’t get over insane theory after Haliburton’s injury
content: Tyrese Haliburton's injury in the NBA Game 7 finals, resulting in a loss for the Indiana Pacers against the OKC Thunder, has sparked a bizarre theory. Fans are pointing out a possible 'jersey number 0 curse,' noting similarities between Haliburton's Achilles injury and those of Damian Lillard and Jayson Tatum, who also wear the same number.

title: 'I am watching': Trump asks 'everyone' to keep oil prices down
content: Amidst the Israel-Iran conflict and US airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, oil prices experienced volatility, initially surging before stabilizing. Donald Trump cautioned against escalating prices, fearing it would benefit adversaries. Market anxieties persist due to potential disruptions in global oil supply via the Strait of Hormuz, impacting stock markets worldwide.

title: End of cybercrime? How ISRO and DRDO are building India’s unhackable network
content: India is making significant strides in quantum communication, driven by ISRO and DRDO innovations. These advancements aim to create unbreakable encryption for data, banking, and health records. The nation's three-level quantum strategy combines fibre optics, free-space, and satellite-based QKD to secure communications across various distances, positioning India as a key player in the global quantum race.

title: Watch: 'Bengaluru masterpiece' tower in the middle of the road goes viral
content: A video of a high-tension electric tower standing in the middle of a Bengaluru road near Hebbal has gone viral, sparking amusement and criticism online. The unusual placement has ignited discussions about urban planning and infrastructure development in the city. While some find humour in the situation, others point to potential issues of corruption or oversight in the planning process.

title: IND vs ENG Test | 'Monk at work' - KL Rahul slams 9th Test century
content: KL Rahul exhibited resilience and skill, scoring his ninth Test century and third in England at Headingley. His composed, unbeaten innings, featuring 13 boundaries, helped India extend their lead after an early setback with Shubman Gill's dismissal. Rahul's landmark innings builds upon his previous centuries at the Oval and Lord's, solidifying his reputation as a formidable overseas Test batter.

title: Middle East crisis: Supertankers making U-turns near Strait of Hormuz
content: Following US military strikes on Iran, tensions in the Middle East are disrupting global energy supplies, as evidenced by supertankers rerouting near the Strait of Hormuz. This critical chokepoint, responsible for a significant portion of oil and gas shipments, faces potential closure threats, causing oil prices to surge and prompting shippers to adopt cautious strategies amid escalating geopolitical risks.

title: Kaliganj bypolls: TMC's Alifa Ahmed secures landslide victory against BJP's Ashish Ghosh
content: Alifa Ahmed of the Trinamool Congress won the Kaliganj Assembly bypoll by a significant margin, surpassing her late father's previous victory. The election, triggered by Nasiruddin Ahmed's death, saw a peaceful voter turnout. Inspired by Mahua Moitra, Alifa left her IT career to pursue politics.

title: 'Tell Bumrah to play all 5 Tests': Gavaskar requests pacer's wife Sanjana Ganesan, gets a cheeky reply
content: Jasprit Bumrah showcased his bowling prowess in the first Test against England. He achieved his 14th five-wicket haul, despite dropped catches. The BCCI plans to manage Bumrah's workload during the series. Bumrah's recent form is remarkable, outshining other Indian pacers. He equaled Kapil Dev's record for away five-wicket hauls. Bumrah also leads among Indian bowlers in SENA countries.

title: Before & after: Satellite images show damage caused to Iran’s nuclear sites after US strike
content: Satellite imagery reveals substantial damage to Iran's Fordow and Natanz nuclear facilities following reported US strikes. Fordow shows impact sites and potential tunnel collapses, while Natanz has a crater above its underground enrichment area. Despite the damage, the IAEA reports no radiation releases. Isfahan nuclear research facility also targeted, but no radiation leakage reported.

title: How India defied US and went nuclear
content: The truth is that politicians of various vintages played a part, irrespective of their worldview or political leanings. Every one of them was of the opinion that the Ayatollahs of Potomac (a delightful term coined by TOI legend K Subrahmanyam, the father of the current external affairs minister) couldn’t be the only ones with the power of the sun in the palm of their hands.

title: Smoke engulfs skyline: Iranian missile hits Israel's Ashdod; IDF strikes Tehran - video
content: Tensions escalate as Iran and Israel exchange aerial attacks, with a missile striking near an Israeli power station and disrupting electricity. This follows US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites, prompting retaliation. International concern rises as the conflict widens, with calls for diplomacy and warnings about the Strait of Hormuz closure. Iran seeks support from Russia amid ongoing hostilities.

title: Assembly bypolls: AAP retains 2 seats in Punjab, Gujarat
content: Arvind Kejriwal asserted that Gujarat is weary of the BJP, highlighting AAP's Visavadar win and BJP's Kadi victory in Gujarat bypolls. He also celebrated AAP's anticipated win in Punjab's Ludhiana West, noting increased support compared to 2022.

title: Watch: Rishi Sunak explains how following Dharma helped him become first Hindu UK PM
content: It was not just an abstract idea. Sunak revealed that Dharma was the principle that guided his decision to step into the chaos of British politics in 2022—after losing the Conservative Party leadership race, only to return weeks later as Prime Minister following Liz Truss’s resignation and a market meltdown.

title: India vs England Test: 'Itna tameez se khelne ke chakkar mein ... ' - Rishabh Pant's complaint to KL Rahul
content: Rishabh Pant, known for aggressive batting, was heard on the stump mic advising himself to stay calm during the first Test's Day 4 against England. Pant's remarks to KL Rahul about defensive play were also captured.

title: 'Can’t kill my father, so I’m ending my life': Haryana man harassed by wife and her lover
content: Magan alias Ajay, a resident of Rohtak, tragically ended his life due to alleged harassment by his wife, Divya, and her boyfriend, Deepak, a police officer. Magan accused them of mental torture, demanding money, and pressuring him to commit heinous acts.

title: WWE RAW today preview: Full match card & show highlights revealed
content: WWE RAW returns on June 23, 2025, with exciting matches. Becky Lynch defends her Intercontinental Title against Bayley. Jade Cargill faces Roxanne Perez in the Queen of the Ring semi-finals. Cody Rhodes battles Jey Uso in the King of the Ring semi-finals. Goldberg will appear to address his upcoming match against Gunther.

title: Kaliganj bypoll: Bomb blast rocks Nadia during vote counting; 13-year-old girl dies
content: A tragic incident occurred in West Bengal's Nadia district where a nine-year-old girl died in a bomb explosion in Barochandgar. The explosion took place during the Kaliganj assembly bypoll counting. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed shock and grief, assuring strict legal action against the culprits.

title: UP shocker: Jilted lover shoots girlfriend dead, kills self in Kannauj
content: In Kannauj, Devansh killed Deepti over her arranged marriage. He shot her at her home in Sultanpur village. A village meeting had occurred before the murder. Devansh then killed himself near a pond. The police found his body with his father's licensed gun. Deepti's family had arranged her marriage to someone else.

title: Top 5 news: Ranbir Kapoor's 'Awara' look sparks rumours of Raj Kapoor tribute and others
content: Ranbir Kapoor's new look is stirring rumors of a Raj Kapoor tribute, while Diljit Dosanjh faces criticism for potentially working with Hania Aamir. Samay Raina has made a comeback to YouTube after controversy, and Nushrratt Bharuccha is receiving backlash for her behavior at a Yoga Day event. Additionally, Mandhira Bedi revealed a painful estrangement from her late brother.

title: 'We don't want to raise brats': Anushka on parenting with Kohli
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli, admired for their parenting, prioritise a balanced upbringing for their children, Vamika and Akaay. Anushka emphasized in an old interview the importance of love, respect, and shared responsibilities within the family unit. The couple aims to shield their children from social media's glare, allowing them to choose their online presence later.

title: 'Zabardasti try kar raha': Pant's self-talk on stump mic goes viral- WATCH
content: Rishabh Pant's on-stump mic self-talk in Hindi revealed his struggle to balance aggression and composure during his innings. He advised himself to play straight and avoid unnecessary risks, as translated by Dinesh Karthik. Despite a first-innings century, Pant seemed caught between his natural game and restraint.

title: "Only Marathi Is Mandatory In Maharashtra Schools, Not Hindi": Minister
content: Maharashtra Cultural Affairs Minister Ashish Shelar on Monday made it clear only Marathi is mandatory in the state, and not Hindi, and said the ongoing controversy on teaching a third language in schools was "unreasonable and illogical".

title: "Hate Speech Won't...": Top Court On Man Arrested Over Social Media Posts
content: The Supreme Court on Monday took a strong exception to communal tweets by Wajahat Khan, the complainant in Sharmistha Panoli's case, who is now himself under arrest over social media posts. The top court said that hate speech won't take us anywhere.

title: 30 Wives Killed by Husbands in 115 Days, Reveals Data From Chhattisgarh
content: As social media floods with memes and mockery of so-called "deadly wives" after the arrest of Sonam Raghuvanshi for the murder of her husband Raja Raghuvanshi in Indore, a chilling reality is emerging from Chhattisgarh.

title: "Hindi Not Compulsory": Maharashtra Minister Amid Language Row
content: Amid growing concern over the alleged imposition of Hindi in Maharashtra schools, state Culture and IT Minister Ashish Shelar has clarified that there is no compulsion to learn Hindi, and that Marathi remains the only compulsory language.

title: "Keep Oil Prices Down. I Am Watching": Trump Amid Middle East Tension
content: US President Donald Trump expressed a desire on Monday to see oil prices kept down amid fears that the aftermath of the attacks on Iran's nuclear facilities could cause them to spike.

title: Trump Got Iran's "Sleeper Cell" Threat At G7, Then Ordered Strikes: Report
content: In the days leading up to the US' surprise military strike on Tehran's three nuclear sites, Iran warned it would activate sleeper cell attacks on American soil if the operation went ahead, according to a report by NBC News.

title: Robotics Engineer Sends 21 Bomb Threats To Gujarat To Frame Man She Loved
content: A probe into e-mails threatening blasts at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad and different places in 12 states has unravelled a tale of unrequited love and vengeance allegedly unleashed by a woman

title: SpaceX Launches Dog's Ashes To Space On Memorial Flight
content: A dog's ashes were among the remains sent into space this weekend as part of a memorial mission honouring loved ones by carrying them beyond Earth's atmosphere.

title: Ghost Of GBU-28: When US Bunker-Buster Bomb Shattered Saddam's Last Hope
content: American air power has been deployed several times to "establish democracy" and fight terrorism in the Middle East. In 1990, when Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait, the US launched Operation Desert Storm to fight the Iraqi forces.

title: Israel Strikes Revolutionary Guard Sites And Evin Prison In Tehran
content: Israel hit Revolutionary Guard sites and the notorious Evin prison in Tehran on Monday, calling them its most powerful strikes yet on the Iranian capital on the 11th day of the war.

title: Hormuz Blockade Threatens Energy Security Of Asia's Largest Economies
content: Around 84 percent of oil passing through the Strait of Hormuz is destined for Asia, leaving the economies of China, India, South Korea and others vulnerable should Iran blockade the crucial trading route over US strikes on its nuclear sites.

title: Owner Of Flat Where Sonam Raghuvanshi, Killers Lived Suspected Of Hiding Evidence
content: The owner of a flat in Indore where murder-accused Sonam Raghuvanshi and her aides lived after killing her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, and was under the scanner of the Meghalaya police for concealing evidence, has been caught.

title: Bed, Toilet, Microwave Oven: B-2 Bomber Is A Flying Hotel Armed With Bombs
content: The B-2 bomber, the epitome of American air supremacy, was once again in action to destroy Iranian nuclear sites. They flew from the Whiteman Air Force base in Missouri, United States, refuelled several times mid-air, flying continuously.

title: US To Screen Social Media Accounts Of Visa Applicants In These Categories
content: In a move aimed at strengthening visa screening procedures, the United States has announced that effective immediately, all individuals applying for an F, M, or J non-immigrant visa are required to adjust the privacy settings on all of their social m

title: Is Delhi Monsoon-Ready? 445 Trouble Spots Raise Alarm
content: Monsoon clouds looming overhead, Delhi is bracing for another season of waterlogged roads and traffic snarls. This year though, the threat could be bigger than before.

title: Tech Tycoon's Yacht Lifted To Surface, 10 Months After It Sank Off Sicily Coast
content: Salvage experts lifted Mike Lynch's sunken superyacht to the surface and began pumping seawater out of it on Saturday, 10 months after it sank off the coast of Sicily, killing the British tech tycoon, his teenage daughter and five others.

title: Jagan Reddy's 'No Z+ Security' Charge After Row Over Car Running Over Man
content: Former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister and YSRCP chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has strongly criticised Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, accusing him of degrading the standards of politics in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Man Beats 17-Year-Old Daughter To Death For Low Marks In NEET Mock Test
content: She scored 92.60 per cent - marks many students aspire to get - in her Class 10 board exams. More than a year later, she was killed by her father for scoring low marks in a mock test.

title: Bride Killed, Groom Injured After Gunmen Open Fire At Wedding In Southeast France
content: A 27-year-old bride was killed when gunmen attacked a wedding party in a village in southeastern France, with one of the assailants also dying during the assault, prosecutors said on Sunday.

title: Honeymoon Murder Sparks Trend: Professional Probe Into Prospective Brides
content: In Madhya Pradesh, where weddings are often celebrated with opulence and tradition, a new trend is quietly taking root, one that blends suspicion and surveillance.

title: LSU wears crown as college baseball's premier program

title: 2025 NBA Finals: OKC crowned champion in winner-take-all Game 7
